A couple of the blog posts on the site are showing with no author/picture when you see the summary but when you click into the blog their details are there. There are 3 in November:

Sharing the educational legacy of the Games around the UK
13 November 2009

Being a part of London 2012 - 9th November

Sir Steve encourages the young athletes of Northern Ireland to be inspired – 11th November.

If you need anymore information from me then let me know

Thanks

Lianne

Lianne, i believe i fixed the problem with the first one Blog post ~ but Sir Steve's Post is having a sererate issue. Actually i'm having trouble finding him atall, could you tell me where he is in this list: 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/blog/authors 
or in this one: 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/folder/blog/contributors

I had another look and could not find a sir-steve-redgrave in the cms ( which is what the post points to ) so i reckon he had never been created. I wrote the this component in a way that it would display 2012 staff in case the contributor was missing ~ to not end up with dead links ~ so this would be correct behavior. To fix it, just create him and republish the post.

We're just republishing those pages, Lars made a change to the news/blog on the home pages which in turn effected the news/blog lists everywhere else.

Were in the process of syncing a copy of the live site back to the dev server * so we can test this stuff before it gets rolled out. Thanks Huw, We did look at that page (a long time ago) and followed up on the best practice stuff like correct SPF records, making sure our link text matched the url it was linking to. As far as I can tell Microsoft's Sender ID Framework program is just another term for SPF records http://www.microsoft.com/mscorp/safety/content/technologies/senderid/wizard/default.aspx One last option we haven't yet tried is to pay for a 3rd party white listing service like ReturnPath (previously called to be Sender Score Certified) http://www.returnpath.net/commercialsender/certification/ http://www.senderscorecertified.com/about/fees.php I did have a vague feeling Morag looked into this (Morag do you remember anything about it?). Happy to spend some time investigating the above further, unless you think there is someone better placed at LOCOG to do this on a company wide basis? I expect you also want this to cover email sent on your behalf by a whole bunch of providers. The pricing for ReturnPath isn't inconsequential and is based on volume so you may prefer to negotiate / handle costs here directly if this is a route you think it is sensible for us to go down. Jamie btw. #Morag#, this is more one for Demy's I just generated a new SPF record (sorry for the geekyness - SPF is the entry in 2012's DNS records that says 'it's fine for Kitsite's servers to send email on our behalf') anyway I just generated a new record which included a include:kitsite.com bit. Maybe you could just forward them this question, thanks: We have just re-generated an SPF record for the london2102.con domain to include the server/IP address 89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com) [which is already in the current record] however we noticed that the domain kitsite.com was listed explicitly 'include:kitsite.com' in this version and wondered if that would have any impact on the success / failure of emails delivered from 89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com) on london2012.com's behalf. What we have: "v=spf1 ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 mx ~all" What the MS SPF wizard recommends, notice the inclusion of include:kitsite.com I'm not totally sure we need it but it may help, although I'm sure Demy's are far more knowledgeable about this that me. v=spf1 mx ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 include:kitsite.com ~all On 14 Dec 2009, at 11:43, Huw Williams wrote: Dear Both You might already have gone down this route but here is a response to the email problem Thanks From: Andy Smith [mailto:andsmith@microsoft.com] Sent: 08 December 2009 08:04 To: Huw Williams Subject: RE: Email problem - can you help? Hi Huw, Have got a response from the Hotmail team. They have advised that the best way to investigate the problem is to raise a support incident at: http://postmaster.live.com/ Are you able to access this site and raise the issue? Andy I have a slightly offbeat question that you might (or might not) be able to answer. If you can't, not a problem, but I thought I'd ask anyway. We seem to be having some problems sending bulk emails from our mailing list to Hotmail domains and we wondered if there was anything we could do about this problem and if you could help. Like I said, you might not be able to help but thanks for trying -----Original Message----- From: Morag Reavley Sent: 03 December 2009 17:54 To: Jamie Unwin; Huw Williams Subject: RE: Microsoft white labelling Great - thanks, Jamie! -----Original Message----- From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] Sent: 03 December 2009 17:32 To: Huw Williams Cc: Morag Reavley Subject: Re: Microsoft white labelling Hi Huw The raw headers / body of the signup email is below. They get sent with a From and Reply to address of registration@london2012.com The actual server sending them is milo.kitsite.com (89.187.66.118) which has a SPF record in the london2012.com DNS jamie-674:~ jamie$ dig +short TXT london2012.com "v=spf1 ip4:213.48.118.37 ip4:213.121.128.0/26 ip4:89.234.20.132/28 ip4:213.215.157.240 ip4:213.121.129.192/26 ip4:89.187.66.118 ip4:62.140.221.10 ip4:202.60.76.30 ip4:194.116.199.82 ip4:213.86.53.6 mx ~all" The issues seems to be that a higher than average (average being compared to gmail / yahoo) number of Hotmail users not confirming their email address. Which seems to suggest Hotmail users on a whole don't like confirming their email address or that Hotmail is spam filtering them. In our tests (done a while back) the later seemed true, namely that they we're ending up in the junk folder. Although some are obviously getting though as we do have Hotmail users. Hope that's enough info to get started. To convert latest News/Blogs components to related we'll need to update the latest :

- create a related blog, news function
- test it works
- update the templates where this is currently used:

Generic hub
Video
Virtual tour
Venue
Photo page
Generic content
Sport

* do all these templates/pages need to show related news/blogs or do some just want to still show just the latest?

- test site to check this hasn't broken anything
- republish all pages using those templates (we may have mix of both versions while this happens.

Related content will only be related at time of publication.

Latest news / Latest blogs should appear on the associated hub and the home page.

Suppress header if no related news/blogs and check a missing column (news or blogs) won't throw the layout out.
 
Unless otherwise stated the news will be related by relevancy *not* date.

I think it makes sense to factor time in some. Could we try a weighting
system? So tag matching is weighted like 70% and time 30%.

 

We'll also probably need to change 'latest news' to 'related news'.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com <http://www.london2012.com> 

www.twitter.com/london2012team

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 10 December 2009 16:27
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Convert latest News/Blogs components to
related (on the following templates)
Importance: High

Hi Liz,

The news and blog widgets should now be showing related content (will need to republish the site for changes to take effect on live server)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/games-heritage/index.php

- Content is now pulled in based on number of matching tags
- The last 30 days (at the point at which the page is published) is given a boost

Once your happy we can bulk publish the relevant pages.

thanks

Jamie

ps. the weighting formula is scary/complex ( http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_1_0/api/org/apache/lucene/search/Similarity.html ) and so questions along the lines of  'why is page X appearing befre page Y may result in me jokingly sending you that link ;-) the short answer is it's based on that formula and it can be very time consuming to figure it out for any two pages. If pages are really not appearing that should then we can investigate, but just letting you know upfront it can be very time consuming, so lets save for pages that you *really* think should be appearing in a particular order that aren't.

Well, that page looks brilliant. I'll go check out a few more sections,
and let you know, but it's looking great!

 

Liz Goulding

Does that look like a tag from Getty? we had this issue before where by they sent the tags as one long string rather than:

1) split by a comma
2) sent as separate fields

We can't just split on spaces as some tags have spaces.

This is what Getty need to send.
<gyi:value name="GYI_KEYWORDS">Stories of the World, Billy Bragg, major project, culture, MLA</gyi:value>

We also coded it to deal with multiple <GYI_KEYWORDS>fields with one phrase each, so if that is easier for them.

Until Getty fix the issue this will continue to happy (we can limit a single tag to X chars but expect this isn't what you want?)

If you send an image you can check the tags at http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php

Jamie

So I think we've discovered at least one of the problems. The field
GYI_Keywords is the GETTY keywords, *not* the CMS keywords. Fort his
file, Amy sent through 2 CMS keywords, 'dressage', and 'eventing' and
there don't seem to be anything named appropriately. See below.

earlier today. And that one is definitely missing the *meta* tags in
the CMS (like equestrian for both sport and paralympic sport, and the
venue information for Greenwich park) and those certainly are in the
xml.

Actually Lars just said that you can no longer update the url in browsers on the fly due to security settings in IE so that isn't even an option.

I think if we're going to the point of rewriting the whole page on the fly complete with url then we may as well send the browser to a new url and let it do it the normal way, ie. the way the page behaves if you turn off javascript.

I think the problem is the content isn't clear enough from the design, looking at it again the page title / browser titles *shouldn't'* change, but the title under the image should (as per CogApps original design, although we have now changed the way this work, which I;m not sure was a good move *). If it was more obvious that what you we're doing was flicking though photos 'in page' then the problem would go away. 

If you want was can change the way it works, by removing the Javascript that is run when you click on an thumbnail and instead just let it take you to a new page, but are you sure this is what you want? (we'll also need to republish all the images)

a call on it tomorrow? I'm confused again. :-/

If not then either:
i) it should
ii) the blog/news module should be made into an include, and /that/ should be republished whenever a blog is published.

(actually no reason not to do both)

Kieran

I decided against a republish the homepage ~ trigger and rather melt the latest/news includes into versions that are usable sitewide ( instead of the prev. use for just being used as modules )

So now:
   Both tabs are now using includes 
   Includes are published on any news/blog publishing event

I also stopped the jumping when switching between the blog/news tab!
